creditline: Collection of Yvonne and Gabriel P. Weisberg
description:
cat. 28; profile of head and shoulders of woman wearing scarf

profile of a peasant woman with hair in scarf; buildings and fields in background; grey border; cream mat; gold frame with black sides
medium: Watercolor and gouache on cream wove paper
text:
Born in Germany of English parents, Louis Welden Hawkins moved to France and trained as a painter at the Acad√©mie Julian in Paris. He lived in France for the rest
of his life and took French nationality. Although his early works are in a realist vein, Hawkins was closely linked to the symbolist milieu. He was always a careful observer of female figures, in his realist as well as his symbolist phase. Peasant Woman in a Landscape is a straightforward and compassionate recording of the personality of this larger than-life figure.
title: Peasant Woman in a Landscape
